title: Jenna Bush Hager shares new photos of her 'sweetest Hal-pal'– her newborn son Henry Harold
text:
CLOSE Jenna Bush Hager announced on the "Today" show that she's expecting a third child with husband Henry Hager. USA Today

Jenna Bush Hager can't get enough of her baby boy.

The "Today" co-host, 37, took to Instagram Friday to share new pictures of her "sweetest Hal-pal in the whole world," nine-week-old son Henry Harold "Hal" Hager.

"Two months (and a day!!)" she captioned the close-up shots.

The pictures show off Hal's growing personality, including a snapshot of the boy stretching his arms, yawning and, of course, catching some precious z's. In another black-and-white photo, Bush Hager gently cradles her little bundle of joy.

Bush Hager, the daughter of former President George W. Bush, welcomed Hal with husband Henry Hager on Aug. 2. The couple share two other children, Mila, 6, and Poppy, 4.

Jenna Bush Hager welcomes third child:'My dad was a little mad the name wasn't George'

The TV anchor said it was her daughters who nicknamed their little brother "Hal-pal."

"We weren't exactly sure about the name," Bush Hager said when she called into the "Today" show following his birth. "Then his big sisters called him 'Hal-pal,' and we thought, 'This is just perfect.'"

'Donuts and tacos': Jenna Bush Hager gets the ultimate hospital delivery after having baby

Jenna Bush Hager arrives at the 74th annual Golden Globe Awards at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Beverly Hills, Calif. on Jan. 8, 2017. (Photo: Jordan Strauss, Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP)

Her father, on the other hand, was hoping for a moniker closer to his.

"My dad was a little mad that the name wasn't George," Bush Hager joked, before clarifying, "He said it was a cool name."

She later gushed on Instagram that "life with Hal is so, so sweet."

More: Jenna Bush Hager's new baby boy Hal met Hoda Kotb's daughter and hearts melted

description: Jenna Bush Hager shared new pictures of her "sweetest Hal-Pal in the whole world," nine-week-old son Henry Harold "Hal" Hager.
